retailStore

Class InventoryManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • retailStore.InventoryManager

  • public class InventoryManager
extends java.lang.Object
    This class reads the item.txt and supplier.txt and creates a Inventory class and many Order classes Note: The way this class is set up, it receives a string of all tools that should be ordered then create new Order
    Author:
    zchem

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      InventoryManager(java.lang.String supplierFile, java.lang.String itemFile)
      Constructor where the Inventory class is initiated, add two methods are invoked First method: addSupplierList(String) which reads supplier.txt and store it in Hasshmap Second method: addItemsToInventory(String) reads items.txt and adds tools to Inventory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItemsToInventory(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method reads the item.txt and creates a new tool in Inventory for each line in items.txt
      void addSupplierList(java.lang.String fileName)
      This method reads the supplier.txt and stores the id and supplier name in hashmap.
      java.lang.String checkQuatity()
      This method invokes #checkQuantity() which returns the quantities for each tool
      void decreaseQuantity(int id, int amount)
      This method invokes #decreaseQuantity(int, int) which decreases the quatity of a tool by amount specified by user.
      java.lang.String generateOrder(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> lis)
      This method traverse through @param lis and creates a new Order and store it in local variable }
      java.lang.String searchByID(int id)
      This method invokes Inventory.searchToolByID(int) which searches tool by ID
      java.lang.String searchByName(java.lang.String name)
      This method invokes #searchToolByName(String) which searches tool by name
      java.lang.String toString() 
      void updateInventory()
      This method invoke Inventory.checkStock() which traverses through all the tools and orders new tools that has quantity below 40
      void writeFile(java.lang.String textOrder)
      This method writes the return of generateOrder(ArrayList) into a txt file.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventoryManager

        public InventoryManager(java.lang.String supplierFile,
                        java.lang.String itemFile)
        Constructor where the Inventory class is initiated, add two methods are invoked First method: addSupplierList(String) which reads supplier.txt and store it in Hasshmap Second method: addItemsToInventory(String) reads items.txt and adds tools to Inventory
        Parameters:
        supplierFile - file name of supplier.txt
        itemFile - file name of item.txt

        public java.lang.String generateOrder(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> lis)
        This method traverse through @param lis and creates a new Order and store it in local variable }
        Parameters:
        lis - contains a list of tools to be ordered
        Returns:
        combined string of all the orders

      • addSupplierList

        public void addSupplierList(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method reads the supplier.txt and stores the id and supplier name in hashmap. Note: there wasnt a need to store the other info of the suppplier.txt
        Parameters:
        fileName -

      • addItemsToInventory

        public void addItemsToInventory(java.lang.String fileName)
        This method reads the item.txt and creates a new tool in Inventory for each line in items.txt
        Parameters:
        fileName -

      • writeFile

        public void writeFile(java.lang.String textOrder)
        This method writes the return of generateOrder(ArrayList) into a txt file. checks if file exists or not, if file exists then merge previous and new orders
        Parameters:
        textOrder - All the orders for today in a string

      • updateInventory

        public void updateInventory()
        This method invoke Inventory.checkStock() which traverses through all the tools and orders new tools that has quantity below 40

      • searchByName

        public java.lang.String searchByName(java.lang.String name)
        This method invokes #searchToolByName(String) which searches tool by name
        Parameters:
        name - passed from Front end
        Returns:
        the tool as a String

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the tool in a string

      • decreaseQuantity

        public void decreaseQuantity(int id,
                             int amount)
        This method invokes #decreaseQuantity(int, int) which decreases the quatity of a tool by amount specified by user. Note, if decreased amount > actual amount then set the quatity to 0
        Parameters:
        id - of the tool to decrease
        amount - to decrease
